channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report I-2024080049
item.description:
Report I-2024080049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: HATTIESBURG
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 45000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver failed to slow down for a clover leaf curve resulting in the unit rolling over onto the driver side. Single vehicle crash. During the roll over event, dirt built up inside the crash box, breaking the piping from the crows foot. Product start escaping the tank through the broken pipe inside the crash box due to the way the unit came to rest.

item.title: Report E-2024060113
item.description:
Report E-2024060113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T00:45:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: CREOLA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 4
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL AT CONSIGNEE LOCATION OFFLOADING OPERATIONS STARTED. DUE TO A SLIGHT LEAK AT THE EXTERNAL VALVE CONNECTION CONSIGNEE PERSONEL REJECTED LOAD REQUIRING REPAIR AT OFF-SITE LOCATION. DRIVER PROCEEDED TO REPAIR FACILITY FOR ASSISTANCE. AT EVENT LOCATION, CTMV WAS BROUGHT TO DOORWAY OF REPAIR FACILITY DUE TO WEATHER CONDITIONS. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ASSIST MECHANICS BY REMOVING EXTERNAL VALVE FROM HOUSING. ONCE VALVE REMOVED FROM PIPE PRODUCT FLOWED FREELY INTO ENVIROMENT. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ACTUATE EMERGENCY SHUTOFF. ACTIVATION OF EMERGENCY SHUTOFF FAILED TO STOP FLOW OF PRODUCT. FACILITY EVACUATED DUE TO PRODUCT RELEASE AND INABILITY TO HAULT FLOW FROM TRAILER. VAPOR CLOUD RESULTED FROM PRODUCT FUMES AND WET WEATHER AT TIME OF INCIDENT. DRIVER SUFFERED CHEMICAL BURNS DURING ATTEMPT TO REMOVE VALVE AND HAULT FLOW, WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL. INTERNAL INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY CAUSE OF FAILURE AT THIS POINT APPEARS TO BE INTERNAL VALVE SEATING WHICH PREVENTED PROPER OPERATION OF INTERNAL VALVE SEALING VESSEL. SUPPLIMENTAL REPORT WILL BE FILED WITH ADDITIONAL DETAILS.

item.title: Report E-2024080581
item.description:
Report E-2024080581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one hundred and fifty (150) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. The remaining product was transferred to a new poly tote and deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used granular absorbents. The spent material was recovered and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
